title: (x) Bulldog internet ad - ITC American Typewriter Alt {Yves}
content:

 [‹ (x) Harper's Bazaar nameplate and cover titles - Didot (custom designed), H&FJ Didot {Mike Diaz}](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122055417/http:/typophile.com/node/19811 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Typeface on finley.nu website - FF Scala, Dolly {Stephen, Mike Diaz} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122055417/http:/typophile.com/node/19812 "Go to next forum topic")
author: dunknik

comments.content: Do you mean the text in ITC American Typewriter (Alternate), or the logo which is customised Clarendon?

As long as we’re being thorough, “BROADBAND FROM CABLE & WIRELESS” is set in Arial.

- Lex

The logo is Clarendon Extra Bold Rounded with a customised ‘g’. I think…

_…I am always hesitant to second guess Mr. Condensed but I reckon I’m right._

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/clarendon-2/clarendon-extra-bold-rounde...](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122055417/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/clarendon-2/clarendon-extra-bold-rounded/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/clarendon-2/clarendon-extra-bold-rounded/")

I didn’t really look any further into the logo face, so second guess me all you want, Conor. I have been wrong before. _Several_ times. :^P

It’s not because I keep the place clean that I’m top dog around here. ;^)
